DOC.brief_summary: To compare the efficacy of three different long-term treatment strategies of reflux disease in primary care setting.
DOC.brief_title: Nexium (Esomeprazole) in Symptom Adapted Therapy in GERD Patients
DOC.criteria: Subjects who seek medical advice in primary care for symptoms thought to be GERD related (GERD is a condition which develops when the reflux of stomach content causes troublesome symptoms and / or complications). Subjects with any clinical GERD treatment (PPI, H2receptor antagonists) within the last 3 months prior to Visit 1. A history of severe esophagitis or known other complications, with alarm symptoms
